Package cipher

Class SubstitutionTreeSearch

java.lang.Object
cipher.SubstitutionTreeSearch
public class SubstitutionTreeSearch
extends java.lang.Object
Class implementing the Monte-Carlo Tree Search for solving substitution ciphers used by the University of Alberta.
Author:
Max Wood
See Also:
Paper

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram
    A class to contain an nGram and its score in the same place to facilitate easy comparison.

  • Constructor Details

    • SubstitutionTreeSearch

      public SubstitutionTreeSearch​(Substitution s, Mapping[] initialKey, FileIO u, PredictWords p, DetectEnglish d)

  • Method Details

    • monteCarloTreeSearch

      public Mapping[] monteCarloTreeSearch​(java.lang.String text, boolean spaced)
      Generates the optimal decryption of the cipher text based on word and character level n-grams.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be decrypted.
      spaced - Whether or not the spaces in the original text are to be preserved.
      Returns:
      An array of Mappings corresponding to the decryption of the text.

    • scorePath

      private void scorePath()
      Scores all nodes in the current path to the leaf node.

    • expand

      private SearchNode expand​(SearchNode leaf)
      Generates the next best decryption of the cipher based on the current best.
      Parameters:
      leaf - The current best node in the Monte-Carlo search tree.
      Returns:
      The best child of the leaf.

    • MappingArrayToString

      private java.lang.String MappingArrayToString​(Mapping[] key)
      Converts a given array of Mappings to a string.
      Parameters:
      key - A key for decryption of the cipher.
      Returns:
      The string representation of the key.

    • addToHashMap

      private void addToHashMap​(Mapping[] key)
      Method to aid in abstraction of putting Mapping arrays into a hash map so they can be compared.
      Parameters:
      key - The mapping array to be inserted into the map.

    • orderKey

      private Mapping[] orderKey​(Mapping[] key)
      Sorts a given key into alphabetical order based on the cipher character for each Mapping.
      Parameters:
      key - The Mapping array to be sorted.
      Returns:
      The sorted array.

    • findLeaf

      private SearchNode findLeaf​(SearchNode current)
      Recursively selects the optimal path from the root node to the best leaf of the search-tree.
      Parameters:
      current - The node currently being evaluated.
      Returns:
      The leaf node.

    • generateCLambdas

      private void generateCLambdas()
      Generates the character lambda coefficients for determining the score of a decrypted text.

    • generateWLambdas

      private void generateWLambdas()
      Generates the word lambda coefficients for determining the score of a decrypted cipher text.

    • determineMaximum

      private int determineMaximum​(double[] values)
      Determines the index of the maximum value in an array of doubles.
      Parameters:
      values - The array of doubles from which the maximum is to be found.
      Returns:
      The index of the maximum value in the array.

    • keyScore

      public double keyScore​(Mapping[] mappings, boolean spaced)
      Scores a given simple-substitution cipher key.
      Parameters:
      mappings - The key to be analysed.
      spaced - Whether or not there are already spaces present in the text.
      Returns:
      A double representing the score of the key.

    • wordScore

      private double wordScore​(java.lang.String toAnalyse)
      Scores a given nGram based on the probability of its existence.
      Parameters:
      toAnalyse - The nGram to be scored.
      Returns:
      The score of the sum of the probabilities of its constituent parts.

    • characterScore

      private double characterScore​(java.lang.String toAnalyse)
      Scores a given nGram based on the probability of its existence.
      Parameters:
      toAnalyse - The nGram to be scored.
      Returns:
      The score of the sum of the probabilities of its constituent parts.

    • generateKeyMutations

      private java.util.List<Mapping[]> generateKeyMutations​(Mapping[] parentKey)
      Generates a list of mutated keys based on the occurrence of probable character-index-form representations in the cipher text.
      Parameters:
      parentKey - The key on which the mutations are based on. This provides some categorisation within the search tree,
      Returns:
      A list of mutated keys.

    • mutateKey

      private Mapping[] mutateKey​(Mapping[] parentKey, SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram scoredNgram)
      Generates a mutation of a given key based on a likely n-gram in the text.
      Parameters:
      parentKey - The key to be mutated.
      scoredNgram - The n-gram on which the mutation is to be based.
      Returns:
      The mutated key.

    • bestPEquivalentNGrams

      private SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram[] bestPEquivalentNGrams​(java.lang.String cipherText, int n, int k)
      Generates the best k p-equivalent n-grams of size n from the target text.
      Parameters:
      cipherText - The text from which the n-grams are to be derived.
      n - The length of the n-grams to be searched for.
      k - The number of n-grams to be examined.
      Returns:
      An array of the best k scored n-grams.

    • replaceIfBetter

      private SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram[] replaceIfBetter​(SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram[] bestNgrams, SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram toTest)
      Searches an array of scoredNGrams and replaces the first n-gram whose score does not exceed that of the n-gram to be entered. Insertion sort.
      Parameters:
      bestNgrams - The array to searched.
      toTest - The scored n-gram to be inserted if it has a sufficiently high score.
      Returns:
      The array of the best scored n-grams, with or without replacement.

    • fetch

      private double fetch​(java.lang.String nGram)
      An interface between the gets to the maps of n-grams and their occurrences to avoid null returns when the value is not found. If the combination is not found it is assumed to be the minimum possible likelihood of occurring.
      Parameters:
      nGram - The nGram to have its score fetched from its respective map.
      Returns:
      The score of the nGram.

    • generateArray

      public SubstitutionTreeSearch.scoredNgram[] generateArray​(int length)
      Generates an array of scoredNgrams to avoid null-pointer exceptions when comparing scores.
      Parameters:
      length - The length of the array to be generated.
      Returns:
      The array of minimum scored scoredNgrams.
